The pattern of liver injury can provide clues to the underlying etiology. In this case, the patient's liver injury is likely due to ischemia resulting from his initial hypotensive episode. Ischemic hepatitis, or 'shock liver,' results from a decrease in hepatic blood flow, which in this patient was likely due to his diverticular bleeding and resultant hypotension.
